title.narrative: CEN - ECHO - Early Recovery Response in Sindhupalchowk

description.narrative: The action will build the ACT Alliance's work on shelter, water, sanitation and hygiene to cover the emerging needs for the current stage of the response. The action will also address a number of cross cutting needs for IDP communities who have been impacted by the disaster. Particular attention will be paid to targeting the needs of women, the elderly, IDPs, People Living with Disabilities (PLWDs) and Dalit communities who have so far been neglected by the response. The proposed recovery action will provide an opportunity to communities who would otherwise not be able to recover by themselves and who have not been reached by other actors. The action will reach remote, affected communities in 14 VDCs (13 full VDCs and one municipality in Makawanpur).

The proposed action will work in an integrated manner with the decision makers, authorities, vulnerable communities and other stakeholders to address the core issues of vulnerability and to ensure all response activities are conducted in a participatory manner. The proposed action will consider structural and non-structural aspects of shelter safety and has ensured that shelter and WASH activities are presented as a comprehensive response package. The action aims to build a culture of safety and resilience through its integrated response model, ensuring coordinated capacity building actions. The action will ensure that the recovery activities supported by project will be linked to the respective clusters and to the government guidance at line agency at district level.
